name: FileBrowser - File Creation, Upload, Listing, and Deletion
description: Verify login, creating new files and folders, uploading files, listing directory contents, renaming, downloading, deleting files, and verifying all changes in the file manager UI
steps: Navigate to http://localhost:8087/ in the browser
Verify the login page loads showing the File Browser logo, a username field, a password field, and a Login button
Enter 'admin' in the username field and 'admin12345678' in the password field and click the Login button
Verify successful login by confirming the file manager dashboard loads showing an empty root directory with the toolbar at the top
Click the 'New Folder' button in the toolbar to create a new folder
Type 'Test Documents' as the folder name in the prompt and confirm
Verify the folder 'Test Documents' appears in the file listing
Double-click on the 'Test Documents' folder to navigate into it
Verify the breadcrumb navigation shows the path as 'Test Documents' and the directory is empty
Click the 'New File' button in the toolbar to create a new text file
Type 'notes.txt' as the file name and confirm
Verify the built-in text editor opens for the newly created file
Type 'This is a test note for QA verification.' into the editor and click the Save button
Navigate back to the 'Test Documents' folder using the breadcrumb and verify 'notes.txt' is listed with a non-zero file size
Click the 'Upload' button in the toolbar to open the file upload dialog
Select a sample file (e.g., a small image or text file) from the local system and upload it
Verify the uploaded file appears in the 'Test Documents' folder listing alongside 'notes.txt'
Navigate back to the root directory using the breadcrumb
Click the 'New File' button, name it 'readme.txt', and confirm
Type 'Root level readme file.' in the editor and save it
Navigate back to the root directory and verify both 'Test Documents' folder and 'readme.txt' are listed
Select the 'readme.txt' file by clicking its checkbox and click the Rename button in the action bar
Rename the file to 'project-readme.txt' and confirm
Verify the file is now listed as 'project-readme.txt' in the root directory
Click on 'project-readme.txt' to open it and verify the content still reads 'Root level readme file.'
Navigate back to the root directory, select the 'Test Documents' folder by clicking its checkbox, and click the Delete button
Confirm the deletion in the confirmation prompt
Verify the 'Test Documents' folder and all its contents (notes.txt and the uploaded file) are removed from the listing
Select 'project-readme.txt' by clicking its checkbox and click the Delete button and confirm
Verify the root directory is now completely empty with no files or folders listed
